definition:
The *medial triangle* of a triangle $\triangle ABC$ is the triangle
formed by joining the midpoints of the sides of the triangle
$\triangle ABC.$

![image](med.eps)

Here, $\triangle A'B'C'$ is the medial triangle. The incircle of the
medial triangle is called the *Spieker circle* and the incenter is
called the *Spieker center*. The circumcircle of the medial triangle is
called the *medial circle*.

An important property of the medial triangle is that the medial triangle
$\triangle A'B'C'$ of the medial triangle $\triangle DEF$ of
$\triangle ABC$ is similar to $\triangle ABC.$

![image](med1.eps)
